subject: AI & Agents
title: Clustering: Finding Natural Groups
description: A 60-second lesson on Clustering: Finding Natural Groups.

hook.text: You have a million customers and no labels. How do you find meaningful segments? Let the data cluster.

buildup.text: Clustering groups similar data points together without any predefined categories.

discovery.text: K-means picks k centers and assigns each point to its nearest center, then readjusts repeatedly.

twist.text: You must choose k â€” the number of clusters â€” before running. Choose wrong, and the groups are useless.

climax.text: Clustering powers customer segmentation, gene grouping, and anomaly detection.

punchline.text: The data has structure. Clustering reveals it.

quiz.question: What does clustering do with unlabeled data?
options: Groups similar data points together automatically
Assigns predefined labels to each point
